intro: Ayenia incallida, commonly known as the Mexican sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its bright orange to red ray florets and yellow disk florets, which give it a striking appearance. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and often reddish in color. Ayenia incallida thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardeners seeking vibrant, easy-to-grow ornamental plants.
